message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $14,000. It's a great deal, and I think it's worth your consideration. Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $11,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I think that's the most I can go.

Bob, I appreciate your offer, but $11,000 is simply too low for me. I'm willing to come down to $13,000, which is still a great deal for you.  Let's meet in the middle and see if we can close this deal.
I understand your position, but $13,000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, so I'll offer $12,500. I think this is a fair price for both of us.

Bob, I appreciate you coming up with a new offer.  $12,500 is getting closer, but it's still a bit too low for me. How about we meet in the middle again?  I'm willing to come down to $13,500.  This is a great price for you, and it's closer to what I need. Let's close this deal.

I'm starting to get a bit frustrated with the back-and-forth, but I'm willing to keep negotiating. I'll meet you halfway again, so I'll offer $13,250. This is as high as I'm willing to go, so I hope we can finally come to an agreement.

Bob, I hear your frustration, and I'm also ready to close this deal.  I'm willing to come down to $13,400.  That's just a little bit more than your last offer, and it's still a great deal for you. Let's call it a day and get this done!
I'm getting close to walking away, but I'm willing to make one more offer. I'll meet you at $13,200. This is my final offer, and I hope you can meet me in the middle.
